CatDescriptText: Oliver Mason (1903-1979), was a police patrolman from 1944 to 1964, and was promoted to detective 1964-1968. Based in Hill District, he had a reputation for shooting first and asking questions later; one of his nicknames was "Two Guns."  Here, he has stepped forward from a line of policemen to shake hands with an official at an evening ceremony.Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 15, 1964, pg. 3, reads: "Taking Bows - ...At right, obscured by another officer, Mayor David L. Lawrence is handing to Patrolman Mason a Distinguished Service Medal, as some of Pittsburgh's 'finest' also won honors."
TitMainTitle: Police officer Oliver Mason standing in front of row of six police officers and receiving Distinguished Service Medal from Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence, at ceremony at Forbes Field
